txt.en:
'What are we to do? The Easterling folk shall descend upon us and destroy us!

'I should ask this, but could you -- nay, I cannot say it. Oh, but I must! Would you return to the Easterling camp and defeat them before they can move against us?

'I fear it is the only way to ensure our survival. If you will do so, speak with me again.'

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This instance quest is meant to be run Solo and cannot be run in a group.</rgb>
'Many thanks to you, [placeholder]! Without your courageous efforts on our behalf, I am certain these evil Men would have butchered us in our sleep!\n\n'Take this as a token of our gratitude.'
'Go now, my friend...bring us life!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This instance quest is meant to be run Solo and cannot be run in a group.</rgb>

Nafrati, the captain of the Easterlings in the Rushgore, informed you that they would descend upon the Woodmen and destroy them.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This instance quest is meant to be run Solo and cannot be run in a group.</rgb>
Talk to Amal when you are ready to confront the Khundolar

Amal is at the Woodman camp in the heart of the Rushgore.

You should speak with Amal when you are ready to depart for the Easterling camp.

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This instance quest is meant to be run Solo and cannot be run in a group.</rgb>
Talk to Amal at the Woodman camp in the Rushgore
Amal is at the Woodman camp in the heart of the Rushgore.\n\nYou should return to Amal with news of your victory over the Easterlings.
